Definition.WordDefinition:
Adversity \Ad*ver"si*ty\, n.; pl. {Adversities}. [OE. adversite, F. adversit['e], fr. L. adversitas.] 1. Opposition; contrariety. [Obs.] --Wyclif. [1913 Webster]
Adversity is not without comforts and hopes. --Bacon. [1913 Webster]
Syn: Affliction; distress; misery; disaster; trouble; suffering; trial. [1913 Webster]

adversity n 1: a state of misfortune or affliction; "debt-ridden farmers struggling with adversity"; "a life of hardship" [syn: {hardship}, {hard knocks}] 2: a stroke of ill fortune; a calamitous event; "a period marked by adversities"
